instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (or maybe it 1466) backlight intermittent
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> had a little liquid spill. i cleaned and replaced <CAPACITOR>C8317</CAPACITOR> and ran a wire to LVDS pin 3-4, worked fine for a while then sometimes backlight goes out so I did <CAPACITOR>C7796</CAPACITOR>,

but now some time later its acting up again. seems more like at cold startup, like it takes some time to warm up. should i replace the other caps <CAPACITOR>C7797</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7799</CAPACITOR> or do those not go bad?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (or maybe it 1466) backlight intermittent
threads.message: Boot without flat cable to the IO board. If still issues probably corrosion under <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> or bad feedback trace to ball A5.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (or maybe it 1466) backlight intermittent
threads.message:
io cable off, new <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> did no different, ran wire for feedback, still same
you think its the lvds socket? there was a burn there but it was working till now, maybe it finally shorted out?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (or maybe it 1466) backlight intermittent
threads.message: So you ran a wire to a burned LVDS connector without replacing it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (or maybe it 1466) backlight intermittent
threads.message: it was working so i didn't replace it

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (or maybe it 1466) backlight intermittent
threads.message: Replace the connector. Since you already replaced the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> I assumed you made sure bkl en was present and checked that everything in the area was ok right? Like the caps and resistors in the area
